result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith Andre Cruse was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Defendant does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 18 months Initial Confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Probastion to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.

miscConds.notes:
$200.00.  Payee to be determined at restitution hearing. 
*7/14/2015  To be paid to Community Financial Service Center.

Pay all costs, surcharges and restitution, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by end of probation. 
If revoked, out of up to 25% prison funds.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.  
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.   Civil rights suspended until reinstated. Order received and filed.
Mental health evaluation.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with Verna R. and Community Financial Service Center.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

timeConds.notes: Forthwith.  Defendant eligible for the Day Reporting Center.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keith Andre Cruse

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, Origina SENTENCING Transcript (52 pages) commencing 07/07/15 .
Converted at request of Court Reporter Kelly Janowski.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Per Written Explanation Sheet in file:  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Restitution in the amount of $200.00 previously stipulated at sentencing on July 7, 2015, should be paid to Community Financial Service Center filed and signed by the Court.
Restitution in the amount of $200.00 previously stipulated at sentencing on July 7, 2015, should be paid to Community Financial Service Center, filed.

Defendant Keith Andre Cruse in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Keith Andre Cruse in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference to address restitution in Branch 26.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    

 Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.    The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 4 1/2 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 1/2 years with credit for 124 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.  The Court STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
*As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 135 days in the House of Correction.   FORTHWITH.   The Court finds the defendant eligible for the Day Reporting Center.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health evaluation.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with Verna R. and Community Financial Service Center.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Parties stipulate to restitution in the amount of $200.00.  Payee to be determined at restitution hearing.  

 - Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and restitution,  including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation.  If revoked,  out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 18 months initial confinement.

- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Keith Andre Cruse not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests Projected guilty plea and sentencing hearing.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

Defendant Keith Andre Cruse in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Keith Andre Cruse in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for DAILY Supervision to monitor his medications..

Defendant Keith Andre Cruse in court with attorney Melissa Fitzsimmons for attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Keith Andre Cruse in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin via telephone.  Dr. Trueman's report addressed; no challenges.  Court finds defendant competent to proceed.  Proceedings reinstated.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Parties notified. Return of Doctor's reschedule to May 13, 2015 at 1:30 pm.
Parties notified of Doctor's Report Return set for May 12, 2015 at 8:30 am. Review hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 is vacated.
Report from Dr. Trueman received and filed. tk
WCS Forensic Tracking Report received and filed with court.
Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) received, signed, and filed with court.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE HEARING IN BRANCH 26.

Defendant Keith Andre Cruse in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Keith Andre Cruse in custody. Lucy Kronforst appeared for James C. Griffin for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties stipulate to the the Doctor's report. Court ordered a Commitment for Treatment. Case adjourned for a Review Hearing in Branch 26.  Order of Commitment For Treatment (Incompetency) received, signed, and filed with court.  Review hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Forensic Unit Report by Dr. Mary Kay Luzi received and filed with court.

Defendant Keith Andre Cruse in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  
Defendant Keith Andre Cruse in custody.  
Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.   
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
